text:
Is there a module similar to
```{% module "email_subscriptions" path="@HubSpot/email_subscriptions" %}```
that works in pages? Looking to embed the subscription preferences form on a web page that is not a system page

Hey all, does anyone else get issues where macros in css sometimes work but then sometimes dont? They all used to work when in the CSS but now it looks like I need to be moving them out into the HTML file for it to work.
Same with {{ get_asset_file }}. Just seems flakey? or do we just think it's user error? I can't be the only one having these inconsistencies?
Couldn't you clone this module then fetch it and manipulate it to exactly how you want?
or even copy the raw code. In the fetched module, you'll see the function/code used to display email_subscriptions
If you copy, you can just check in the design manager <@UJ3G9FH9U>

```{% email_subscriptions
    "email_subscriptions"
    resubscribe_button_text="{{ module.resubscribe_button_text }}",
    unsubscribe_single_text="{{ module.unsubscribe_single_text }}",
    subheader_text="{{ module.subheader_text }}",
    unsubscribe_all_unsubbed_text="{{ module.unsubscribe_all_unsubbed_text }}",
    button_text="{{ module.button_text }}",
    label="{{ module.label }}",
    header="{{ module.header }}",
    unsubscribe_all_option="{{ module.unsubscribe_all_option }}",
    unsubscribe_all_text="{{ module.unsubscribe_all_text }}"
%}```
but wherever you do end up putting it, you need to make sure the parameters are being complete so you'll have to match the fields.json
There has to be an issue with caching or something because on some pages the transtion macro works but on others it doesn't
<@U017U9BRUPP> what u mean by transition macro?
The one you guys have provided as a macro in the docs.
can u send ur page link where its not working?

also things like getting colors from themes will work but then not work later in the day.
I'll just suddenly see "~color: ;"~ in inspect where it suddenly can't get the theme color
